climbs.name: Crowbar Carnage
climbs.fa: Luke Mehall, Dave Marcinowski, FFA: Aaron Voreis

content.description: This is the rightmost route on the wall. It starts just left of a 3rd class slab. The beginning section is spicy, then it gains a nice crack system, and it finishes with a hand crack through a small roof.
content.protection: Standard rack of nuts and cams up to #3 Camalot.

climbs.name: Crepe Crack
climbs.fa: Luke Mehall, Dave Marcinowski, FFA: Mark Grundon

content.description:
Starts in a splitter crack just right of

Core Shot Crack

. Eye a chockstone in the crack, which appears to be chossy, but after attempts to be cleaned seems to be bomber. Climbs up various broken cracks to the very thin crack up top, which is the crux.
content.protection: Standard rack up to #3 Camalot with thin nuts and cams for the crux up high.
content.location: This is the middle of the three established lines on the wall.

content.description: This is the leftmost splitter crack on the wall. It starts in an offwidth, then it follows the crack system up and right.
content.protection: A normal rack of cams and nuts, with one large cam (#4 Camalot).
